intro: Brachyotum strigosum, commonly known as the hairy brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Brachyotum strigosum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-shade to full sun conditions.
